dialogueTree.title: Primer Book: "You see a colourful primer. The tit..."
dialogueTree.english: You see a colourful primer. The title reads: "A Primer for Small Kids."
dialogueTree.polish: Widzisz kolorowy elementarz. Jego tytuł to „Elementarz dla małych dzieci”.
dialogueTree.belarusian: Вы бачыш каляровую азбуку. Яе назва — "Азбука для маленькіх дзяцей".

links.title: Primer Book: "It's exactly like a primer -- a wor..."
links.english: It's exactly like a primer -- a word on every page relating to a letter of the alphabet.
links.polish: Wygląda jak elementarz – na każdej stronie jest jakieś słowo związane z konkretną literą alfabetu.
links.belarusian: Выглядае як буквар – на кожнай старонцы ёсць нейкае слова, звязанае з канкрэтнай літарай алфавіту.

links.title: Primer Book: "I'm not sure what you're planning t..."
links.english: I'm not sure what you're planning to get from this. It's meant for babies. Literal babies.
links.polish: Nie jestem pewien, co chcesz w ten sposób osiągnąć. To książka dla dzieci. Dosłownie.
links.belarusian: Я не ўпэўнены, чаго ты хочаш дасягнуць такім чынам. Гэта кніга для дзяцей. Буквальна.

links.title: Plaisance: ""A highly educational primer. It's..."
links.english: "A highly educational primer. It's exceptional for the young mind... and obviously, very popular."
links.polish: „Bardzo edukacyjny elementarz. Świetny dla młodych umysłów... i oczywiście bardzo popularny”.
links.belarusian: "Вельмі адукацыйны буквар. Выдатны для маладых розумаў... і, вядома, вельмі папулярны".

links.title: You: ""Oh wow, that's cool. I want to bec..."
links.english: "Oh wow, that's cool. I want to become smarter."
links.polish: „O rany, ale czadowo. Chciałbym się stać mądrzejszy”.
links.belarusian: "О Божа, як крута. Я хацеў бы стаць разумнейшым".

links.title: Plaisance: ""You're a grown man, though. It's a..."
links.english: "You're a grown man, though. It's a bit too late for that... this is a book for small children."
links.polish: „Jest pan dorosłym mężczyzną. Na elementarz jest już chyba odrobinę za późno... To książka dla małych dzieci”.
links.belarusian: "Вы дарослы чалавек. Для элементарнай кнігі, напэўна, ужо крыху позна... Гэта кніга для маленькіх дзяцей".

links.title: You: "I want to buy this Primer."
links.english: I want to buy this Primer.

links.title: Plaisance: ""Uh... you have kids?" She shudders..."
links.english: "Uh... you have kids?" She shudders uncomfortably. "Okay, I guess. Enjoy it."
links.polish: „Ee... Ma pan dzieci?” – pyta, lekko drżąc na tę myśl. „W porządku. Dobrej zabawy”.
links.belarusian: "Ээ... У вас ёсць дзеці?" – пытаецца, трохі дрыжучы ад гэтай думкі. "Добра. Добрага настрою".

links.title: Savoir Faire: "You peek at the storekeep, waiting..."
links.english: You peek at the storekeep, waiting for her to be distracted. When she's not looking, you deftly swipe the small booklet off the shelf and stuff it in your pocket.
links.polish: Zerkasz na księgarkę, czekając, aż się czymś zajmie. Kiedy nie patrzy, zręcznie zgarniasz książeczkę z półki i wsuwasz ją sobie do kieszeni.
links.belarusian: Глядзіш на кніжніка, чакаючы, пакуль ён чымсьці зоймецца. Калі ён не глядзіць, дужа здымаеш кніжачку з паліцы і кладзеш яе сабе ў кішэню.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "You now proudly own a primer book f..."
links.english: You now proudly own a primer book for small children which, to be honest, barely cost anything.
links.polish: Jesteś teraz dumnym posiadaczem elementarza dla małych dzieci, który, szczerze mówiąc, był i tak prawie darmowy.
links.belarusian: Цяпер вы ганарысты ўладальнік буквара для маленькіх дзяцей, які, шчыра кажучы, і так быў амаль бясплатным.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Slowly, you move your hand towards..."
links.english: Slowly, you move your hand towards the small book. Before you even can reach it, you're interrupted:
links.polish: Powoli przesuwasz dłoń ku książeczce. Zanim jednak jej dosięgasz, słyszysz głos:
links.belarusian: Паўольна перасоўваеш далонь да кніжачкі. Але перш чым ты яе дасягаеш, чуеш голас:

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant coughs sharply, then..."
links.english: The lieutenant coughs sharply, then whispers: "Let's not. Defrauding small business owners is not our *thing*."
links.polish: Porucznik kasła głośno, po czym szepcze: „Lepiej nie. Okradanie właścicieli małych firm to nie jest nasza *specjalność*”.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант гучна кашляе, потым шэпча: "Лепш не. Абкраданне ўладальнікаў малых фірмаў — гэта не наша *спецыяльнасць*".

links.title: Plaisance: ""Sir, please, no touching the merch..."
